text.text_translated: "The Life of Pi" is a book. It tells a very special story about a young boy from India. His name is Pi. His ship sinks in the Pacific Ocean. He is on a small boat with a big tiger. Yann Martel wrote the book. He is a writer from Canada. He wrote it in 2001. It was his third book. The book is very popular. It sold more than seven million copies in the world. It also won many prizes. People translated it into 41 languages. Martel's father had an important job for his country. He worked in other countries. So, when Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

feedback.feedback: The text is a flawless example of A2 writing. All complex vocabulary (e.g., 'extraordinary', 'shipwrecked', 'ferocious', 'diplomat') has been expertly replaced with simple A1/A2 words or clear, simple explanations ('had an important job for his country'). Sentence structures are simple and declarative. The passive voice ('been translated') was correctly changed to the active voice ('People translated it'). Factual accuracy is perfect. No violations of the A2 standard were found.
